very very visible struggle it's a

which is very seen and there is another

going parallel to the political struggle
it struggled to defend the Egyptian
tolerance as you say uh against the neg
negative interpretation of the religion
and I insist it is a negative
interpretation of the religion and not
the religion itself because we have had
a very tolerant interpretation of the
Islam for centuries in Egypt that's why
we had very modern society uh since the
19th century we had the woman everywhere
in in education in University and
administration everywhere we had the
first parliament in the Arab world we
had the first constitution because the
our interpretation of the religion was
very tolerant and the religion was not a
burden for for us was never a burden so
uh now beginning from the 80s the whole
world is influenced by a different
interpretation what we call the wahabism
the wahabism is coming from the desert
and it's a very negative closed
aggressive interpretation of the
religion not only uh aggressive against
the non-muslims even aggressive
aggressive against the Muslims who are
not following the same interpretation
and uh this has been on and on in Egypt
and uh I must tell you that the Saudi
Arabia is powering billions of dollars
to distribute this or to promote this
interpretation everywhere even in Europe
you see uh and we are defending our
interpretation so in Egypt you have
these two struggles and I think they are
very linked in the sense that if we
